XH3 Crypto


Information

  • AES(Advanced Encryption Standard)

    You need to create a key file, which includes a key to server encryption.
    AES is a variant of Rijndael which has a fixed block size of 128 bits, and a key size of
    128, 192, or 256 bits.
    The design and strength of all key lengths of the AES algorithm (i.e., 128, 192 and 256)
    are sufficient to protect classified information up to the SECRET level. TOP SECRET
    information will require use of either the 192 or 256 key lengths.

  • RSA (Rivest–Shamir–Adleman)

    You need to create a key file, which includes two keys to server encryption.
    RSA is one of the first public-key cryptosystems and is widely used for secure data
    transmission.
    RSA enVision is a security information and event management (SIEM) platform, with
    centralised log-management service that claims to "enable organisations to simplify
    compliance process as well as optimise security-incident management as they occur.

  • BLOWFISH

    You need to create a key file, which includes two keys to server encryption.
    Blowfish is a symmetric-key block cipher, designed in 1993 by Bruce Schneier and
    included in a large number of cipher suites and encryption products.
    Blowfish was one of the first secure block ciphers not subject to any patents and
    therefore freely available for anyone to use. This benefit has contributed to its popularity
    in cryptographic software.
